metadata.Title: CVE-2021-25214 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In BIND 9.8.5 -> 9.8.8, 9.9.3 -> 9.11.29, 9.12.0 -> 9.16.13, and versions BIND 9.9.3-S1 -> 9.11.29-S1 and 9.16.8-S1 -> 9.16.13-S1 of BIND 9 Supported Preview Edition, as well as release versions 9.17.0 -> 9.17.11 of the BIND 9.17 development branch, when a vulnerable version of named receives a malformed IXFR triggering the flaw described above, the named process will terminate due to a failed assertion the next time the transferred secondary zone is refreshed.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-25214` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.15
bind9-host - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.15
bind9utils - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.15
dnsutils - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.15
libbind9-160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.15
libdns-export1100 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.15
libdns1100 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.15
libirs-export160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.15
libirs160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.15
libisc-export169 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.15
libisc169 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.15
libisccc-export160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.15
libisccc160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.15
libisccfg-export160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.15
libisccfg160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.15
liblwres160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.15
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.15').
